meanings.definition: A unit of dry measure equal to one tenth of an ephah.
meanings.sent1: The farmer measured the grain using an omer.
meanings.sent2: The omer was used to portion out the flour for baking.
meanings.sent3: The omer decided to go on strike, claiming it was tired of measuring.
meanings.sent4: The omer stood proudly, a symbol of fair distribution.
meanings.sent5: The omer, like a tiny cup, held just the right amount of grain.

meanings.definition: A sheaf of barley or wheat.
meanings.sent1: The field was filled with omers of golden wheat.
meanings.sent2: The farmer gathered the omers of barley for storage.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children played hide-and-seek among the omers.
meanings.sent4: The omers stood tall in the field, a testament to the harvest.
meanings.sent5: The omers swayed gently in the breeze, a sea of grain.
